channel.description: Managing Encrypted Passwords When managing users in Ansible, you probably want to set user passwords as well. The challenge is that you cannot just enter a password as the value to the password: argument in the user module because the user module expects you to use an encrypted string. Understanding Encrypted Passwords When a user creates a password, it is encrypted. The hash of the encrypted password is stored in the /etc/shadow file, a file that is strictly secured and accessible only with root privileges.
